utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Would you mind by starting with what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so over the last week I've just been feeling some symptoms. It kind of first started with, like a runny nose. That was around like 5 days ago and then it turned into just a lot of congestion, like around my nose and like my throat. And now over the last two days I've been just feeling so much pressure around my nose and around my jaw so I've been getting a lot of pain there as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is your nose still running?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm still getting some discharge and I also feel like I'm getting some dripping at the back of my throat too, especially when I wake up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and could you describe the discharge? Is it clear, yellow, greenish?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, it's fairly clear and sometimes, like a bit white, but like, it's not like green or yellow.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and have you felt that it's difficult to breathe in through either of your nostrils, like it's obstructed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so at night sometimes I have to like turn because one side of my nose gets difficult to breathe from and then it kind of balances out on the other side. So yeah, I do have some obstruction.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any changes to your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so just in the last three days when the congestion got really bad I started losing the ability to smell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any changes to your sense of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, taste is fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any cough or sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no. No cough or sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the symptoms have gone on for five days. Have you had a period of time where you got better and then got sick again?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did kind of have a runny nose last week as well, so probably like 8 days ago but then the runny nose discontinued a little bit but really got worse 5 days ago, but all these other symptoms just happened in the last few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you have pain. Do you feel it in your jaw or do you feel it in the in the front of your nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I would say mainly over the cheeks. It can kind of go near the front of my teeth as well, so like I would say like mostly around the cheeks, jaws and up to the front of my teeth.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, And do you grind your teeth at all at night? or have you had, TMJ issues before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No nothing like that. I think it's not so much on and around my teeth, it's more so just to right below my nose, above my teeth and just around my cheeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no pain in your mouth or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not inside my mouth.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I Don't think I've had a fever. I did feel some chills over the last few days, but just very brief episodes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and over the last few weeks have you had any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you said you didn't have a cough or a sore throat, but have you had any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, not shortness of breath. Just sometimes when my nose gets like really congested, I just turn into like a mouth breather, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK, and have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and any lightheadedness or feeling dizzy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sorry, what was that?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had any rashes or skin changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, then how about any muscle aches or joint aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any muscle weakness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how has your energy been? Any fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, it's been mainly OK, just maybe sometimes difficult to get to sleep with all the all the congestion, but I don't think my energy has been affected too much, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, uh, sorry to go back to this, I don't think I asked. Did you notice any discharge from your eyes or any eye redness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not discharge, but yeah, maybe a little bit of redness.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have your eyes been itchy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm Yeah, a little bit. I would say they have been a bit itchy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright then, do you have any medical conditions that you see a physician for regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, just uhm, its called dyslipidemia.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see, and any medications you take for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just like a Statin medication.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you take any other medications? over the counter? prescribed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, other than that I take multivitamins.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have any allergies to medications or like environmental allergies that might be getting worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you don't experience any symptoms like this when the seasons change?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so. I have had this happen to me, Uh, I would say like once before. It happened like two years ago. It was pretty similar.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and what was done at that time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: At that time it kind of just went away on it's own. It got better. I feel it's definitely worse this time. But at that time I didn't even go to the doctor, it kind of just went away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see. Any recent hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No hospitalizations.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and could you tell me where abouts you're living currently and who you're living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I'm currently living in an apartment by myself, just outside of London.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anybody that you've been around who's had any symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no sick Contacts. And have you traveled anywhere out of the city or province?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've tried to stay home, besides going to work. I just work at the grocery store. Besides that, no, nowhere else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any of your coworkers have any symptoms? Or any coworkers being off sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, we're pretty careful right now with the pandemic.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, yeah, that's great. OK, and do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I quit just a couple of years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, that's great. It's not easy to quit, so that's awesome. And do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just maybe like red wine a couple of times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK, and do you use any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, just, in a month, maybe once or twice, I smoke a joint.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and anybody in the family have any lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and how about any cancer in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no cancers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I think I that was everything I wanted to ask about today. Was there any other symptoms or anything else that you wanted to make sure I knew about today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No,  I think that's all. I just didn't know if I needed any, like, medications or if I needed to get tested. I just wanted to make sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so well, certainly check your temperature to see if you have a fever. And if you do and it's high enough, that will increase the chance that you have a bacterial sinusitis,  and if so, with some of your symptoms, including the discharge, obstruction, loss of smell, and facial pain, that all fits the picture for it and also you had a period where you felt a little bit better and then worse again. So that might require antibiotics, but we will check your temperature and go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, sounds good, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
